docfields.name: GlobalShortcut
docfields.text: This class can handle multiple keys default and active This feature isn t used currently kde4 only allows setting one key per global shortcut Michael Jansen

docfields.name: GlobalShortcutContext
docfields.text: Michael Jansen

docfields.name: GlobalShortcutsRegistry
docfields.text: Shortcuts are registered by component A component is for example kmail or amarok A component can have contexts Currently on plasma is planned to support that feature A context enables plasma to keep track of global shortcut settings when switching containments A shortcut WIN+x can be registered by one component only The component is allowed to register it more than once in different contexts Michael Jansen

docfields.name: GlobalShortcutsRegistry::getActiveShortcutByKey
docfields.text: Only active shortcut are considered

docfields.name: GlobalShortcutsRegistry::getShortcutByKey
docfields.text: Active and inactive shortcuts are considered But if the matching application uses contexts only one shortcut is returned getShortcutsByKey(int key)

docfields.name: GlobalShortcutsRegistry::getShortcutsByKey
docfields.text: Active and inactive shortcuts are considered getShortcutsByKey(int key)

docfields.name: GlobalShortcutsRegistry::isShortcutAvailable
docfields.text: It is available if not used by another component in any context or used by component only in not active contexts

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel
docfields.text: KGlobalAccel allows you to have global accelerators that are independent of the focused window Unlike regular shortcuts the application s window does not need focus for them to be activated KKeyChooser KKeyDialog

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::ComponentUnique
docfields.text: Components Unique Name ID

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::ActionUnique
docfields.text: Actions Unique Name(ID)

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::ComponentFriendly
docfields.text: Components Friendly Translated Name

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::ActionFriendly
docfields.text: Actions Friendly Translated Name

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::Autoloading
docfields.text: Look up the action in global settings using its main component s name and text() and set the shortcut as saved there setGlobalShortcut()

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::NoAutoloading
docfields.text: Prevent autoloading of saved global shortcut for action

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::globalShortcutChanged
docfields.text: A global shortcut is subject to be changed by the global shortcuts kcm action pointer to the action for which the changed shortcut was registered seq the key sequence that corresponds to the changed shortcut setGlobalShortcut setDefaultShortcut 5.0 KF6 add const to the QAction parameter

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::allActionsForComponent
docfields.text: getGlobalShortcutsByComponent

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::allMainComponents
docfields.text: The action strings of the returned actionId stringlists will be empty

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::defaultShortcut
docfields.text: Global shortcuts allow your actions to respond to accellerators independently of the focused window Unlike regular shortcuts the application s window does not need focus for them to be activated setDefaultShortcut() 5.0

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::globalShortcut
docfields.text: and actionId e.g 5.10

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::setDefaultShortcut
docfields.text: For more information about global shortcuts setShortcut Upon shortcut change the globalShortcutChanged will be triggered so other applications get notified globalShortcutChanged 5.0

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::setShortcut
docfields.text: Global shortcuts allow an action to respond to key shortcuts independently of the focused window i.e the action will trigger if the keys were pressed no matter where in the X session The action must have a per main component unique action- objectName() to enable cross-application bookeeping If the action- objectName() is empty this method will do nothing and will return false It is mandatory that the action- objectName() doesn t change once the shortcut has been sucessfully registered KActionCollection::insert(name, action) will set action s objectName to name so you often don t have to set an objectName explicitly When an action identified by main component name and objectName() is assigned a global shortcut for the first time on a KDE installation the assignment will be saved The shortcut will then be restored every time setGlobalShortcut() is called with loading Autoloading If you actually want to change the global shortcut you have to set loading to NoAutoloading The new shortcut will be automatically saved again action the action for which the shortcut will be assigned shortcut global shortcut(s) to assign Will be ignored unless loading is set to NoAutoloading or this is the first time ever you call this method see above loadFlag if Autoloading assign the global shortcut this action has previously had if any That way user preferences and changes made to avoid clashes will be conserved if NoAutoloading the given shortcut will be assigned without looking up old values You should only do this if the user wants to change the shortcut or if you have another very good reason Key combinations that clash with other shortcuts will be dropped the default shortcut will never be influenced by autoloading it will be set as given shortcut() globalShortcutChanged 5.0

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::shortcut
docfields.text: Global shortcuts allow your actions to respond to accellerators independently of the focused window Unlike regular shortcuts the application s window does not need focus for them to be activated that this method only works together with setShortcut() because the action pointer is used to retrieve the result If you would like to retrieve the shortcut as stored in the global settings use the globalShortcut(componentName, actionId) instead setShortcut() 5.0

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::activateGlobalShortcutContext
docfields.text: A global shortcut context allows an application to have different sets of global shortcuts and to switch between them This is used by plasma to switch the active global shortcuts when switching between activities context the name of the context 4.2

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::cleanComponent
docfields.text: If the component is not active all global shortcut registrations are purged and the component is removed completely If the component is active all global shortcut registrations not in use will be purged If there is no shortcut registration left the component is purged too If a purged component or shortcut is activated the next time it will reregister itself All you probably will lose on wrong usage are the user s set shortcuts If you make sure your component is running and all global shortcuts it has are active this function can be used to clean up the registry Handle with care! If the method return true at least one shortcut was purged so handle all previously acquired information with care

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::findActionNameSystemwide
docfields.text: getGlobalShortcutsByKey

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::getGlobalShortcutsByKey
docfields.text: If the list contains more that one entry it means the component that registered the shortcuts uses global shortcut contexts All returned shortcuts belong to the same component 4.2

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::isComponentActive
docfields.text: componentUnique the components unique identifier true if active if not

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::isGlobalShortcutAvailable
docfields.text: The component is only of interest if the current application uses global shortcut contexts In that case a global shortcut by component in an inactive global shortcut contexts does not block the seq for us 4.2

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::promptStealShortcutSystemwide
docfields.text: This is GUI only so nothing will be actually changed stealShortcutSystemwide() 4.2

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::promptStealShortcutSystemwide
docfields.text: promptStealShortcutSystemwide below

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::setGlobalShortcut
docfields.text: If more control for loading the shortcuts is needed use the variants offering more control setShortcut setDefaultShortcut 5.0

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::setGlobalShortcut
docfields.text: This method is suited for the case that only one shortcut is to be configured If more control for loading the shortcuts is needed use the variants offering more control setShortcut setDefaultShortcut 5.0

docfields.name: KGlobalAccel::stealShortcutSystemwide
docfields.text: This applies to all actions with global shortcuts in any KDE application promptStealShortcutSystemwide()

docfields.name: KGlobalAccelImpl
docfields.text: The KGlobalAccel private class handles grabbing of global keys and notification of when these keys are pressed

docfields.name: index
docfields.text: KGlobalAccel Global desktop keyboard shortcuts Introduction KGlobalAccel allows you to have global accelerators that are independent of the focused window Unlike regular shortcuts the application s window does not need focus for them to be activated
